@ Budapest, Hungary 游녧游낕游녧游낕游녧

B Tasting Sessions @ Budapest, Hungary 游꽄游꽄游꽄

Untappd: https://untappd.com/user/SeniorZozo

Facebook: www.facebook.com/beeroda/
V칳born칳 le뤢멺 od Anto춬e, n치dhern치 barva piva, skv캩l칠 aroma. Skv캩l치 콏칤zn치 chu콘 podtr룐n치 jemnou nad칳chanou p캩nou.

From tap at Salon Piva, Bratislava. Clear golden with a white head. Mild aroma with some grainy maltiness, maybe lightly toasted, buttery with a light grassy hop note. Medium watery body with a light sweetness and a light bitterness. Flavor of dried fruits, grainy malt with a hoppy bitterness in the finish.

PET l치hev 1500 ml. Aroma je pln칠, m치 p콏칤jemn칳 z치van kvasnic s lehk칳m sladov칳m obalem. P캩na je b칤l치, jemn치 vysok치 a dr뤢셖칤. Barva samotn칠ho piva je zlat치. Chu콘 je p콏칤jemn캩 sladov치 s lehk칳m kvasnicov칳m z치vanem a velmi jemn칳m ovocn칳m n치dechem. Fini춬 je slab캩 ho콏k칳 a sp칤춬e nedr뤢셖칤. V 칰stech pivo p콢sob칤 pln캩, m치 st콏edn칤 콏칤z a je dob콏e piteln칠. Jedn치 se o velmi p콏칤jemn칳 le뤢멺, kter칳 je jak v chuti tak aroma velmi p콏칤jemn캩 zakulacen칳 a vskutku dob콏e piteln칳.
On tap at GBBF 16. Light pale golden yellow colour, nice big white head. Clean, crisp with a lovely spicy hop bitterness. Easy drinking, ever so slightly thin. Not overcomplicated and nice.
Tap at 100 piv. Clear golden color, stable white head. Aroma is malty with bittering hops. Taste is malty with decent hoppy finish. Good, easy drinkable
Tap at 100 piv. Golden color with medium white head. Aroma of malt, light bitter hops. Taste, malt, light biscuits, bitter malts. Medium long hoppy bitter finish. Good.

Tap at RJ. Clear golden colour. Stable white head. Quite thin bodied, easy drinkable. Low to moderate carbonation. Rather clean, dangerously close to emptiness. Low hops flavour and low grainy maltiness. Also lightly flawed but I can not identify it.overall good, but could be better.
On tap at Beervana in 콫ilina,flavor is moderate sweet,aroma is moderate malty,clear golden color,huge white head,tasty.
Another great lager on tap. Saaz hops, barley malts and water. Drinkable, tasty, reminds me of Kout 12. Maybe this one should be less sweet. Great.

On tap: better than average lager, nicer than mass market beer. Typical Czech beer, for better or worse. I generally prefer "dvanactku" (12 degree pivo, this is an 11) but this is eminently drinkable...

Plastic Bottle 1l from bro ippopotamo36.Taste with ?ika Boban and ?ika Alberto in Vranovo Serbia. 25.09.2015.Pour it golden color with small white head.Aroma of Saaz hops.Taste crispy, smooth, grassy, some diacetil on the end.Ok not bad.

From tap, Pours cloudy golden liquid, big frothy to creamy white head, Aroma: nice balanced malty with hopy saaz notes, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, harmonic taste, malty, with noble saaz notes, light yeasty, slightly fruity, not so hopy as expected, but very enjoyable, Palate: light to medium body, soft to average carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, long sweet and hopy aftertaste, Overall: not the best pilsner style lager, but still very enjoyable and very drinkable. Disturbing points where the slightly fruitness and perhaps would expect more bitterness. All the way very good.

Plastic growler shared in Serbia with friends. Pours a semi clear golden color, very little white cap. Nose: (butter) biscuits, grassy Saaz hops. Mouth: milled grains, straw, relevant grassy hoppiness a bit peppery.. The growler spoiled this beer I think, I assume it is taste when super fresh.
Bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma - Malts, grass, nuts. Taste - Dry, hops, bread.

Bottle. Pours hazy Gold with a thick White head. Aroma of fresh grassy Saaz hops. Flavour has nice toffee malt sweetness and oily hops. Sweetness swells then leads to an assertive bitterness. Antos make some of the best svetle in the country.

Keg at the Brewpub in Slany Day 5 of Fergus and Sarah뇹 Czech jaunt. 3/10/14. Hazed golden yellow coloured pour with a lasting frothy white head. Aroma is lovely fresh grains, yeasty, spicy hop. REally fresh and vibrant on the nose. Flavour is composed of fresh grainy pils malts, yeast, considerable nobel hop, background orange and a little floral. Super tasty stuff. Palate is grainy, crisp ,medium body, highish carbonation with a crisp dry finish. Great beer. Super poundable.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2015 V칳캜ap Zl칳캛asy. Zlat치 farba, biela hust치 pena. V칪켿a sladov치, chme쬺v치. V chuti na za캜iatku sladovos콘, jemne ovocn칠 t칩ny, pln칠 telo a kr치sny hork칳 koniec. Nie moc vydaren치 v치rka. Predt칳m mi chutila ove쬬 viac. Teraz je kvasnicov치 ar칩ma aj chu콘.
PET , Cesky Brod , CZ , Malt,hay,butter,biscuit and grassy aroma , Hazy golden yellow color with smaller lacing head , Sweeter taste with bitter finish , Medium body , Lively carbon , Pleasant beer.
Slovn칤 hodnocen칤 p콏id치m v nejbli뤡뛖 mo룙칠 dob캩, jakmile jej na콘uk치m do po캜칤ta캜e. V치춬 alkohol칤k.
Bottled. Very impressive appearance - golden with a stable thick white foam. Slightly hopped, malted aroma is good as well. Malty body, a bit hopped to the end, locely finish.
Classic Pilsner look. Aroma of Saaz hops, malts. Taste is a bit sweet, light bitter, very refreshing. Thin body, oily slick texture, average carbonation. Very good, refreshing and crisp.

petka z pivovaru. Hazy golden colour, creamy white head, very stable, leaving lacework. Medium-bodied with a malty start, just the right malty sweetness. Perfectly balanced with superb Saaz hop flavours that add some hoppy spice and results in a bitter sweet character. Highly drinkable and really, really, seriously tasty!

Draft at Slunce ve Skle 2013. A light golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, malt, herbs, and hops, leading to a bitter finish.

Draught @ Kulovy Blesk, Prague. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, bread, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, bready, yeast, flowers, fresh grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, very refreshing. 300313

My Bottom Line:
Toasted cereals and fresh herbal hops  evolve in this tight, soft Svetly.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sheet of foam covers the shiny golden.
-The hop character is delicate but vibrant; like freshly-chopped herbs.
-Malts also offer biscuity grain angles.
-Very good stuff, but still cannot compete with Uneticky 12 in a tasting.

PET bottle.

PET bottle I brought back from Cz. Light hazy gold pour, white head and decent lacing. Aroma of honeyed malt, light grassy saaz notes, nutty. Nutty flavor, walnuts, grassy hops, light honey flavor. Carbonation is a tad prickly, light bodied.
Tap @ Brewpub. Pours hazy yellow with a frothy white head and lacings. Grassy, crisp, bready and floral hoppy. Intense and dry. Overly delicious and quaffable.

On tap: Golden, unclear, medium-sized and stable lacy off-white head, moderate yeasty and Saazy nose; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, almost medium bodied and pretty soft; lingering Saazy (료teck칳 polorann칳 캜erve켿치k) finish, balanced by sweet pale malt; a touch of yeast is detectable in the aftertaste. Very good

(draught 0,5l @ Vegas (Brno))
Sweet, light hops, some spicy aroma. Clear golden color. Huge white head. Medium sweet, light bitter, light spicy taste. Medium body. Dry finish. Interesting, distinctive beer, but not so drinkable.

Draught @ Sheffield Tap, Platform 1B, Sheffield, South Yorkshire, England S1 2BP. [ As Anto춬 Unfiltered Pilsener ].ABV: 4.7% Unclear medium orange yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, hay, toasted, light to moderate hoppy, sour grass (good sour grass), grassy. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, ripped fruit, malty, grassy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20111020]
on tap at prague beer festival. quite pleasant pilsener with nice head and palate and hoppy dry taste.

On tap @ the brewpub, Slany, Czech Republic. This is an unfiltered beer, comes hazy golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of grassy hops. Taste is initially moderate sweet malty, good balanced against the bitter hops, which shines thru towards the end. Good crafted Bohemian.

user_location: Cambridge and Kladno(Czech Rep.), Cambridgeshire, ENGLAND
